GameFiles

Class GameObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameFiles.GameObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Background, Collectable, Controllable, Nest, NonControllable

    public class GameObject
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Super class for every object in the game
    Author:
    wolginm
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • GameObject

                  int y,

        y - y location on screen
        width - image width
        height - image height a constructor that takes values for all fields as input parameters

    • Method Detail

      • resetPoly

        public void resetPoly()
        Resets Polygon with its origin at x, y and its size to be its width and height

      • collidesWith

        public boolean collidesWith(GameObject a)
        Parameters:
        a -
        Returns:
        true if there's a collision false otherwise this method compares the x and y coordinates of the gameObjects also taking into consideration each ones width and heights to check whether or not there has been a collision

      • move

        public void move()
        will be defined in subclasses and tell each object how to move

      • collision

        public void collision(java.util.ArrayList<GameObject> gameObjects)
        parameters: None returns: None this method will be defined in subclasses so that each object knows how to handle a collision in the even collidesWith returns true.

      • handleCollision

        public void handleCollision(GameObject g)
        GameObjects version of this method has no effects. overridden in subclasses
        Parameters:
        g - Takes the GameObject to handle its collison.
